intro: Cryptandra spinosa, commonly known as the spiny cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, stiff hairs. Cryptandra spinosa is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and low rainfall.
